text:
- Many customers in industries
(upbeat music)

like online gaming,
(video game beeping)
media, and entertainment,

financial services,
(cash register cha-chings)

healthcare,
(heart monitor beeping)
and the public sector have applications

that require single-digit
millisecond latency
or data residency.
When an AWS region isn't close enough
or within a geopolitical boundary

to meet these requirements,
(buzzer buzzing)
you must provision and manage

your own infrastructure
(wrench clicking)
while using different APIs and tools
than you normally would
to build and run your applications.

AWS Local zones are a new type
of infrastructure deployment
that places compute, storage, database,
and other select AWS services

close to large population
and industry centers.

You can use the services
available in a Local Zone
to build and run your applications
and also seamlessly access the full range
of AWS services available

in the parent region
that the AWS Local Zone
is connected to via Amazon's redundant
and very high-bandwidth private network.

Since local zones are
managed and supported

by AWS,
(phone ringing)

you can get all the
elasticity, scalability,
and security benefits of the Cloud.

You can easily build and deploy
location-sensitive workloads
where you need them,
scale them up or down,
and pay only for the resources you use.

Start using AWS Local
Zones in just a few steps.

Open the AWS Management Console
or a command line interface,
enable the Local Zones of interest,
extend your virtual private Cloud to them,

and then launch EC2
instances, EBS volumes,

and other services to
run your applications.
Get started today with AWS Local Zones

for your latency and
location-sensitive workloads.
(upbeat music continues)
